para.text: list displays a "privacy" icon alongside the methods. Those with a green emphasis are public methods while those with a red emphasis are private. In Smalltalk, this privacy is not enforced but, instead, is used as an indication to the programmer as to how a particular method should be used. Dolphin marks methods by placing them in the

para.text: categories. Some methods may also display a small "up arrow" next to them. This indicates that the method is a override of one defined in a superclass.
